column4: I run Windows XP on FAT32 since Linux is my primary platform.  Full, worry-free RW on my Windows partition far outweighs the advantages of NTFS.
yeah; it's "supported" even, since Windows XP offers to upgrade over Win2k without converting.  You haven't done something "totally bizarre" in some ways if you have to hit MSFT support.
you just lose every advantage of NTFS.  They're significant.  Speed, security, better fault-tolerance... so, it works as well as any FAT32 system ever did. ;)
